details: If the condition evaluates to false, then an #AssertionFailedException# will be thrown.
If the condition evaluates to true, then execution simply continues onward.
If its is necessary to throw an exception and a value is provided, then the value will be the error-message part of the exception.
Unlike assume-statements, assert-statements cannot be disabled.
The condition will be unboxed, if necessary.
checks: The type of condition must be assignable to type boolean.
The type of the message must be either a primitive-type or a reference-type.
The type of message must be assignable to type java.lang.String.
